Utility functions¶

Converters¶

convert_g0_to_ohm(conductance)

Converts conductance in units of \(G_{0}\) to resistance in Ohm

convert_ohm_to_g0(resistance)

Converts conductance in units of \(G_{0}\) to resistance in Ohm

convert_pt_to_sec(value_pt, sample_rate)

Converts points to seconds using the sample rate of the measurement

convert_sec_to_pt(value_sec, sample_rate)

Converts seconds to points using the sample rate of the measurement

convert_to_block_and_trace_num(trace)

Determines the block and trace numbers from the entered overall trace number

convert_to_trace(block_num, trace_num)

Calculates the trace number from all traces using the block number and the trace number in the given block

convert_current_noise_to_conductance(...)

Converts current noise to conductance noise

cm2inch(*tupl)

Converts cm to inch (mostly used for figsize)

point2inch(*tupl)

Converts cm to inch (mostly used for figsize)

Calculations¶

calculate_conductance_g0(bias_v, current[, ...])

Calculates the conductance in units of the conductance quantum \(G_{0} = \frac{1}{12900\;\mathrm{Ohm}}\)

calculate_resistance_r0(bias_v, current_a)

Calculates the resistance in units of the resistance quantum \(R_{0} = 12900\;\mathrm{Ohm}\)

calculate_resistance_ohm(bias_v, current_a)

Calculates the resistance in units of Ohm

get_exponent(num)

moving_average(x, w)

Calculates the moving average of array x with a window size w

log_avg(arr, **kwargs)

Calculates the avg of arr on a log scale

round_bias_steps(bias_steps)

Transforms bias to mV and rounds the to integer values (use this for labeling in images)

find_level(arr, level[, x])

Find the point where an array crosses a pre-defined level

calc_hist_1d_single(data[, xrange, ...])

Calculates a single 1d histogram of the data array in the range xrange

calc_hist_2d_single(x, y, xrange[, ...])

Calculates a single 2d histogram from arrays x and y in the range xrange

interpolate(ind1, ind2[, x, y, log_y])

Parameters:

align_trace(x, y, xrange, align_value)

Aligns traces based on the values of array y at the value align_value

calc_covariance(x, y)

Calculates the covariance of two selected quantities \(\text{Cov}(x,y)=\left\langle(x-\left\langle x\right\rangle)\cdot(y-\left\langle y\right\rangle)\right\rangle\)

calc_correlation(x, y)

Calculates the correlation of two selected quantities.

largest_divisor(num[, limit])

custom_error(arr, **kwargs)

Parameters:

File handling¶

collect_traces(array_of_all, array_of_single)

Add array to a pre-existing array collection by vertically stacking them (like when appending lists, because in numpy append function flattens the resulting array)

load_block_to_list(path_to_block[, ...])

Loads a single block into a list of traces (used for older measurements, stored in binary files using .dat extension)

read_waveform_params(waveform_file, mode[, ...])

Reads data from the waveform file used in the measurement

get_name_from_path(file_path)

Extracts filename from a given Path

get_num_from_name(trace_name)

Extracts number from a string

choose_files(file_array, start_block[, ...])

Select files with block numbers between start_block and end_block

choose_traces(trace_array, first[, last])

Select traces with trace numbers between first and last

sort_by_trace_num(trace_names_array)

Returns the array of trace names sorted by trace numbers instead of alphabetical order

load_scopedata(file_name, home_dir)

Fit Functions¶

fit_func_lin(x, a, b)

Linear function for line fitting

gaussian_fun(x, a, b, c)

Parameters:

Miscellaneous¶

execute_and_measure_time(function_name, ...)

Executes function function_name while measuring the time of execution.

check_date(date)

Check if a date is formatted right

count_bool_groups(bool_arr)

Parameters:

even_ext(arr, n)

Extends array with n elements, by mirroring values adjacent to the edges
